title: Tyne Riverside Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Creek at Tyne Riverside Country Park
images.caption: Creek at Tyne Riverside Country Park Creek joining the Tyne. Adjacent to Hadrian's Way, a path from Wylam to Newcastle along the north bank of the Tyne which carries both Hadrian's Cycleway

images.title: Anthony Foster / Tyne Riverside Country Park
images.caption: Surfaced path in the park. The Country Park is situated over two sites - at Prudhoe and at Newburn. This is the Newburn site looking east towards the village and the site of the Battle of Newburn

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Visitor Centre, Tyne Riverside Country Park
images.caption: Visitor Centre, Tyne Riverside Country Park

images.title: Anthony Foster / Former North Wylam Railway Station
images.caption: Former North Wylam Railway Station in the park. The stones in the centre of the photo are the remains of the eastbound platform.

description: This park follows the River Tyne for four miles through 200 acres of meadows, chalk grassland, woodland and river bank. The park is great for both walkers and cyclists with the Hadrian's cycleway running along the riverside. Hadrian's Wall Path also runs through the park so there is scope for continuing your walk along this path. The park is a short walk from Wylam and Prudhoe train stations and Tyne Valley bus routes. It is about 6 miles west of the centre of Newcastle Upon Tyne and Gateshead. The Ovingham Walk starts from the park. The circular walk visits Ovington and the peaceful Whittle Dene Woods just to the north.
